(September 2013). A person's next of kin (NOK) is that person's closest living blood relative or relatives. Some countries, such as the United States, have a legal definition of next of kin. In other countries, such as the United Kingdom, next of kin may have no legal definition and may not necessarily refer to blood relatives at all. If a person dies intestate with no identifiable next of kin, the person's estate generally escheats (i.e., legally reverts) to the government.
